revised_title: The Discovery and Clinical Use of Colony-Stimulating Factors
tldr: The article discusses the discovery and development of colony-stimulating factors (CSFs), which are proteins that help regulate the production, maturation, and function of white blood cells called granulocytes and monocyte-macrophages. CSFs have been used in clinical settings to boost the formation and function of these cells in patients with infections or other diseases. The four main types of CSFs are GM-CSF, G-CSF, M-CSF, and Multi-CSF, which have been purified and produced in recombinant form for medical use.
